GOD.content: Christian reversal, conversion of Platonism, entrance on scene of a “gift”  transforms Good into Goodness that forgets itself, love that renounces itself; this inaccessible source of Goodness means the donee also receives death
GOD.linkedContent: Christian reversal, conversion of Platonism, entrance on scene of a “gift” transforms Good into Goodness that forgets itself, love that renounces itself; this inaccessible source of Goodness means the donee also receives death

GOD.content: irreplaceable singularity of self [command of goodness] requires a death w/ no possible substitution “Death is mine if it is at all” [see p. 45 death creates possibility, p. 46 death is mine]
GOD.linkedContent: irreplaceable singularity of self [command of goodness] requires a death w/ no possible substitution “Death is mine if it is at all” [see p. 45 death creates possibility, p. 46 death is mine]

GOD.content: for Heidegger, it is in being-toward-death, in promise of death, that one is given sameness of self, Jemeinigkeit, that one hears the call (Ruf), and responsibility comes into play
GOD.linkedContent: for Heidegger, it is in being-toward-death, in promise of death, that one is given sameness of self, Jemeinigkeit, that one hears the call (Ruf), and responsibility comes into play

GOD.content: accession to responsibility through experience of irreplaceability, which is given through apprehension of death
GOD.linkedContent: accession to responsibility through experience of irreplaceability, which is given through apprehension of death

GOD.content: this responsibility must be guilt because responsibility is always unequal to itself: I will never be on the level of this infinite goodness > what gives my singularity, death & finitude, is what makes me unequal to the infinite goodness of the gift
GOD.linkedContent: this responsibility must be guilt because responsibility is always unequal to itself: I will never be on the level of this infinite goodness > what gives my singularity, death & finitude, is what makes me unequal to the infinite goodness of the gift

GOD.content: 2 contradictory moments of responsibility: 1) to answer for what one does and gives as an irreplaceable singularity 2) efface the origin of what one gives
GOD.linkedContent: 2 contradictory moments of responsibility: 1) to answer for what one does and gives as an irreplaceable singularity 2) efface the origin of what one gives

GOD.content: formula tout autre est tout autre disturbs while reinforcing Kierkegaard’s discourse, it means that Abraham’s God is found everywhere something is wholly other; and since each of us [?] is infinitely other in absolute singularity [Abraham’s election is universalized?]
GOD.linkedContent: formula tout autre est tout autre disturbs while reinforcing Kierkegaard’s discourse, it means that Abraham’s God is found everywhere something is wholly other; and since each of us [?] is infinitely other in absolute singularity [Abraham’s election is universalized?]

GOD.content: secret of secrecy, not a hiding something, as in not revealing the truth, but respecting absolute singularity, infinite separation of what binds me to the unique, to one as to the other, à l’Un comme à l’Autre)
GOD.linkedContent: secret of secrecy, not a hiding something, as in not revealing the truth, but respecting absolute singularity, infinite separation of what binds me to the unique, to one as to the other, à l’Un comme à l’Autre)

GOD.content: as soon as I enter into relation w/ absolute other, my singularity enters into relation w/ his on level of obligation & duty, but this binds me to sacrifice, and there are infinite others
GOD.linkedContent: as soon as I enter into relation w/ absolute other, my singularity enters into relation w/ his on level of obligation & duty, but this binds me to sacrifice, and there are infinite others

GT.content: death: the fact that the gift does not return to the donor; death not a natural accident, can only be thought setting out from (à partir du) the gift > neither death nor immortal life can give anything, only a singular surviving can give, “life” in an “economy of death”
GT.linkedContent: death: the fact that the gift does not return to the donor; death not a natural accident, can only be thought setting out from (à partir du) the gift > neither death nor immortal life can give anything, only a singular surviving can give, “life” in an “economy of death”

R.content: in The Experience of Freedom, Nancy puts to use Heidegger’s Jemeinigkeit, as singularity of time, each time, as other time, also “ipseity of singularity”; Derrida has concerns this risks saving the “I can” of voluntary-conscious-intentional-deciding-I-myself, while acknowledging that Nancy divides it, ruins it, w/ interval or trace of a spacing [see p. 51]
R.linkedContent: in The Experience of Freedom, Nancy puts to use Heidegger’s Jemeinigkeit, as singularity of time, each time, as other time, also “ipseity of singularity”; Derrida has concerns this risks saving the “I can” of voluntary-conscious-intentional-deciding-I-myself, while acknowledging that Nancy divides it, ruins it, w/ interval or trace of a spacing [see p. 51]

R.content: for Nancy, “freedom is that which spaces and singularizes,” sharing (partage) as spacing
R.linkedContent: for Nancy, “freedom is that which spaces and singularizes,” sharing (partage) as spacing

MONL.content: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself
MONL.linkedContent: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself

MONL.content: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together in advance, not in unity, identity, but in singularity of its difference to itself: in difference avec soi not d’avec soi
MONL.linkedContent: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together in advance, not in unity, identity, but in singularity of its difference to itself: in difference avec soi not d’avec soi

POO.content: responsibility not in one’s own name but arises in structure of supplementarity: in my name as the name of the other > singularity quakes in exemplary equivocality of this “as”
POO.linkedContent: responsibility not in one’s own name but arises in structure of supplementarity: in my name as the name of the other > singularity quakes in exemplary equivocality of this “as”

POO.content: exemplarity: “example itself, as such, overflows its singularity as much as its identity”
POO.linkedContent: exemplarity: “example itself, as such, overflows its singularity as much as its identity”

OOG.content: for Husserl of “Philosophy of Rigorous Science,” singularity is “oneness of fact in its pure factuality,” eternally apeiron, excludes only, acc. Ricouer, empirical individuality, only ‘factuality’ > the tode ti of brute existence
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl of “Philosophy of Rigorous Science,” singularity is “oneness of fact in its pure factuality,” eternally apeiron, excludes only, acc. Ricouer, empirical individuality, only ‘factuality’ > the tode ti of brute existence

FK.content: the fiduciary “link”, respect, responsibility of repetition in the wager (gage), would precede all determinate community linking all singularities prior to all intersubjectivity
FK.linkedContent: the fiduciary “link”, respect, responsibility of repetition in the wager (gage), would precede all determinate community linking all singularities prior to all intersubjectivity

FL.content: justice addresses itself to the singularity of the other, despite or because it pretends toward universality [?]
FL.linkedContent: justice addresses itself to the singularity of the other, despite or because it pretends toward universality [?]

H.content: “at this very moment”: antinomy of laws in the plural and absolutely singular law
H.linkedContent: “at this very moment”: antinomy of laws in the plural and absolutely singular law

H.content: there are 2 plurals, different at same time: 1) multiplicity, plural laws 2) One + a multiplicity, One + n [plus d’un]
H.linkedContent: there are 2 plurals, different at same time: 1) multiplicity, plural laws 2) One + a multiplicity, One + n [plus d’un]

AF.content: injustice of the justice of the one, the unique, violence of unity
AF.linkedContent: injustice of the justice of the one, the unique, violence of unity

AF.content: Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location
AF.linkedContent: Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location

AF.content: singularity haunted by its own iterability, immanent divisibility, from the origin
AF.linkedContent: singularity haunted by its own iterability, immanent divisibility, from the origin

AF.content: faithful memory of singularity is given over to the specter
AF.linkedContent: faithful memory of singularity is given over to the specter

SPOM.content: singularity of any first time makes it a last time, repetition, each time it is the event itself: a hauntology
SPOM.linkedContent: singularity of any first time makes it a last time, repetition, each time it is the event itself: a hauntology

SPOM.content: a justice beyond the economy of repression, not distributive, not calculable equality, outside of the economy of vengeance, incalculability of the gift and singularity, infinite asymmetry, the an-economic ex-position to others
SPOM.linkedContent: a justice beyond the economy of repression, not distributive, not calculable equality, outside of the economy of vengeance, incalculability of the gift and singularity, infinite asymmetry, the an-economic ex-position to others

SPOM.content: relation of deconstruction to justice, to what must be rendered to singularity of other w/out debt, w/out duty
SPOM.linkedContent: relation of deconstruction to justice, to what must be rendered to singularity of other w/out debt, w/out duty

SPOM.content: differance precipitates absolute singularity, singular because differing
loss of singularity as the experience of singularity
SPOM.linkedContent: loss of singularity as the experience of singularity

POOF.content: [quasi-thesis of POOF] a justice that cares for the humanity in the human (a principle of infinity) would destroy finite proportionality that ordains calculation of worth, in this way it resembles Montaigne’s friendship > it doesn’t, however, in the sense that Montaigne’s disproportion is extremely rare, inegalitarian heteronomy remains in tact: what if a certain equality could be saved in respect of dissymmetrical/heteronomic singularities > this equality would be at once calculable/incalculable, it would count on the calculable
POOF.linkedContent: [quasi-thesis of POOF] a justice that cares for the humanity in the human (a principle of infinity) would destroy finite proportionality that ordains calculation of worth, in this way it resembles Montaigne’s friendship > it doesn’t, however, in the sense that Montaigne’s disproportion is extremely rare, inegalitarian heteronomy remains in tact: what if a certain equality could be saved in respect of dissymmetrical/heteronomic singularities > this equality would be at once calculable/incalculable, it would count on the calculable

POOF.content: the 3rd witnesses a law that interrupts vertigo of singularity (a dual narcissism), 3rd opens up & keeps from closing the question of secrecy > Nietzsche: for the hermit, the friend is always 3rd person (keeps the other 2 [w/in oneself] from sinking to the depths)
POOF.linkedContent: the 3rd witnesses a law that interrupts vertigo of singularity (a dual narcissism), 3rd opens up & keeps from closing the question of secrecy > Nietzsche: for the hermit, the friend is always 3rd person (keeps the other 2 [w/in oneself] from sinking to the depths)

BL.content: historical modalities of texts, writing, literature—each time original (de) authorize text in different ways
BL.linkedContent: historical modalities of texts, writing, literature—each time original (de) authorize text in different ways

MPM.content: textual events accumulated under the name Rousseau, Nietzsche, belong to history or path of that singular aporia called “deconstruction”
MPM.linkedContent: textual events accumulated under the name Rousseau, Nietzsche, belong to history or path of that singular aporia called “deconstruction”

MPM.content: each deconstructive thinking constitutes a text which bears its rhetorical singularity (style of promise, figure of signature)
MPM.linkedContent: each deconstructive thinking constitutes a text which bears its rhetorical singularity (style of promise, figure of signature)

MSUBJ.content: motion of motif, w/out totalization, subjectilian wall: “of this dissociation in the body of which there will always be marked the singularity of the event made work”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: motion of motif, w/out totalization, subjectilian wall: “of this dissociation in the body of which there will always be marked the singularity of the event made work”

MSUBJ.content: everything is singular each time and each time analogical: a figuration of the other
MSUBJ.linkedContent: everything is singular each time and each time analogical: a figuration of the other

A.content: we can never say these are the conditions of inexhaustible singularity of event, must speak in negative form (w/out X no Y) [Derrida against present or presentation of “this is that”]
A.linkedContent: we can never say these are the conditions of inexhaustible singularity of event, must speak in negative form (w/out X no Y) [Derrida against present or presentation of “this is that”]

A.content: if death names irreplaceability of absolute singularity (no one can die in my place or in place of the other) then all examples in world can illustrate this singularity, death of all those who say “my death” is irreplaceable [universal?] > tout autre est tout autre
A.linkedContent: if death names irreplaceability of absolute singularity (no one can die in my place or in place of the other) then all examples in world can illustrate this singularity, death of all those who say “my death” is irreplaceable [universal?] > tout autre est tout autre

A.content: that anybody can appropriate expression “my death” > exemplary complication of exemplarity: nothing more nor less substitutable than syntagm “my death,” hapax legomenon
A.linkedContent: that anybody can appropriate expression “my death” > exemplary complication of exemplarity: nothing more nor less substitutable than syntagm “my death,” hapax legomenon

SEC.content: citational doubling splits (scinder), dissocier d’avec elle-même the pure singularity of the event, as positive possibility (not failure)
SEC.linkedContent: citational doubling splits (scinder), dissocier d’avec elle-même the pure singularity of the event, as positive possibility (not failure)

VM.content: doctrine of uniformity of Being (don Scotus, Heidegger) incompatible w/ Aristotelian-Thomist Being in which question of 1st/2nd [re: universal/singular] remains
VM.linkedContent: doctrine of uniformity of Being (don Scotus, Heidegger) incompatible w/ Aristotelian-Thomist Being in which question of 1st/2nd [re: universal/singular] remains

OH.content: value of universality capitalizes all antinomies, linked to value of exemplarity which inscribes universality in proper body of singularity (idiom or culture)
OH.linkedContent: value of universality capitalizes all antinomies, linked to value of exemplarity which inscribes universality in proper body of singularity (idiom or culture)

PAS.content: pas-à-pas is a metaphor for de-distancing; it is immediately singularly multiple
PAS.linkedContent: pas-à-pas is a metaphor for de-distancing; it is immediately singularly multiple

PAS.content: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none
PAS.linkedContent: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none

PAS.content: viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), exemplary citations, unique power is unscathed possibility of unique, remains in reserve form which “I can emerge”
PAS.linkedContent: viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), exemplary citations, unique power is unscathed possibility of unique, remains in reserve form which “I can emerge”

PPHS.content: Hegel reassembles the feminine law (singularity, sepulcher, night, the divine) around the pit and the pyramid (feminine law only effective in the underworld not on earth)
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel reassembles the feminine law (singularity, sepulcher, night, the divine) around the pit and the pyramid (feminine law only effective in the underworld not on earth)

SH.content: other does not compromise absolute singularity, must speak to other
SH.linkedContent: other does not compromise absolute singularity, must speak to other

SH.content: inscription breaks silence of pure singularity
after saying multiple singular events can conjoin: Celan quoting Benjamin citing Malebranche on Kafka
SH.linkedContent: after saying multiple singular events can conjoin: Celan quoting Benjamin citing Malebranche on Kafka

SH.content: only another singularity, just as irreplaceable, can take the place of singularity w/out substituting for it
SH.linkedContent: only another singularity, just as irreplaceable, can take the place of singularity w/out substituting for it

SH.content: signature not only recalls the vanished as vanished, the singular event, its ash > it gathers together a conjunction of singularities, a partaking in future of same date
SH.linkedContent: signature not only recalls the vanished as vanished, the singular event, its ash > it gathers together a conjunction of singularities, a partaking in future of same date

SH.content: ideality carries forgetting in its memory, the memory of forgetting itself, the truth of forgetting > reference to singular event annulled in ring’s annulation, the date’s turning-about, una volta, volte-face, revolt, revolution
SH.linkedContent: ideality carries forgetting in its memory, the memory of forgetting itself, the truth of forgetting > reference to singular event annulled in ring’s annulation, the date’s turning-about, una volta, volte-face, revolt, revolution

SH.content: mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)
SH.linkedContent: mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)

SH.content: Jew as poet, as “he” w/ unpronounceable name, as witness to the universal through absolute singularity, by virtue of and in name of the other
SH.linkedContent: Jew as poet, as “he” w/ unpronounceable name, as witness to the universal through absolute singularity, by virtue of and in name of the other

FWT.content: there is one principle, but put into effect w/in singularity of context/moment, it will produce different decisions > nothing relativistic or opportunistic in this
FWT.linkedContent: there is one principle, but put into effect w/in singularity of context/moment, it will produce different decisions > nothing relativistic or opportunistic in this

FWT.content: singularity resists, remains, sometimes it even resists being assigned to “subjectivity”
FWT.linkedContent: singularity resists, remains, sometimes it even resists being assigned to “subjectivity”

P.content: paradox of 3rd Critique: singularities must give rise to universalizable judgments > Kant’s free beauty: self-subsisting, always beautiful once
P.linkedContent: paradox of 3rd Critique: singularities must give rise to universalizable judgments > Kant’s free beauty: self-subsisting, always beautiful once

OS.content: Hegel: immediate vanishing of differences [re: dimensions of time as becoming externality: past, future, present] into singularity is the present as Now (die Gegenwart als Jetzt) > vanishing of being into nothing & nothing into being: excludes/continues other moments
OS.linkedContent: Hegel: immediate vanishing of differences [re: dimensions of time as becoming externality: past, future, present] into singularity is the present as Now (die Gegenwart als Jetzt) > vanishing of being into nothing & nothing into being: excludes/continues other moments

ROP.content: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]
ROP.linkedContent: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]

ROP.content: in EN, in interminable conversation w/ Lacan, Derrida thinks contingency, singularity, event, tukhē, which is also a thinking of death, whose signifier would be the phallus
ROP.linkedContent: in EN, in interminable conversation w/ Lacan, Derrida thinks contingency, singularity, event, tukhē, which is also a thinking of death, whose signifier would be the phallus

OTO.content: Dionysus vs. Crucified, name of versus, countername, suffices to pluralize (in a singular fashion) homonymic mask & proper name, to lead all threads of name astray in labyrinth (ear)
OTO.linkedContent: Dionysus vs. Crucified, name of versus, countername, suffices to pluralize (in a singular fashion) homonymic mask & proper name, to lead all threads of name astray in labyrinth (ear)

DPi.content: daimon for Greeks: divine & inferior to divinity of God (theos), revenant, soul of dead, fate—kind of election, singular destiny; in Christianity, daimon is bad spirit, demonic, evil genius
DPi.linkedContent: daimon for Greeks: divine & inferior to divinity of God (theos), revenant, soul of dead, fate—kind of election, singular destiny; in Christianity, daimon is bad spirit, demonic, evil genius

DPi.content: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation
DPi.linkedContent: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation

DST.content: “singularity” not novelty, which is too bound up w/ periodization, or, in the best cases, w/ Heideggerian epochal structures
DST.linkedContent: “singularity” not novelty, which is too bound up w/ periodization, or, in the best cases, w/ Heideggerian epochal structures

DST.content: Derrida’s reservation re: history of Being & its epochs, also re: “configuration”: presupposes too much consistency, too much identifiable collectedness in the figure
DST.linkedContent: Derrida’s reservation re: history of Being & its epochs, also re: “configuration”: presupposes too much consistency, too much identifiable collectedness in the figure

DST.content: despite inevitable impurity of secret of idiom, experience of each remains, in its singular proximity, absolutely different [re: similar paths taken by Nancy, Lacoue-Labarthe, & Derrida]
DST.linkedContent: despite inevitable impurity of secret of idiom, experience of each remains, in its singular proximity, absolutely different [re: similar paths taken by Nancy, Lacoue-Labarthe, & Derrida]

TR.content: event is always traumatic: singularity interrupts normal fabric of temporality/history
TR.linkedContent: event is always traumatic: singularity interrupts normal fabric of temporality/history

TR.content: Rousseau’s appeal to others, appeal to future, belongs to same time, same moment, as “myself alone”
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s appeal to others, appeal to future, belongs to same time, same moment, as “myself alone”

EL.content: Scholem against extinguishing category genius, Derrida adds: secularizing rationalization that flattens, levels out, resistance of any singularity/exception [Nietzsche-like]
EL.linkedContent: Scholem against extinguishing category genius, Derrida adds: secularizing rationalization that flattens, levels out, resistance of any singularity/exception [Nietzsche-like]

HST.content: the 3rd intrudes when 2 absolutes exchange place; the 3rd, question of justice, immediately betrays other’s finite-infinite singularity > thus: congenital perjury of justice
HST.linkedContent: the 3rd intrudes when 2 absolutes exchange place; the 3rd, question of justice, immediately betrays other’s finite-infinite singularity > thus: congenital perjury of justice

HST.content: Abrahamic substitution not a homogenous, identical (cloning) replacement but that of exception, election > implicates (engage) each singularity in responsibility to give, to sacrifice themselves as pledge (comme gage) > still, not a free, voluntary act: there’s grace, a certain passivity
HST.linkedContent: Abrahamic substitution not a homogenous, identical (cloning) replacement but that of exception, election > implicates (engage) each singularity in responsibility to give, to sacrifice themselves as pledge (comme gage) > still, not a free, voluntary act: there’s grace, a certain passivity

HST.content: simple, homogenous, calculation of cloning—but every unit is irreplaceable in its factual existence (Kant)—so to be ethical, must be conscious, must be auto-affected by this uniqueness? > for Derrida, displaced certainty btwn opposition arithmetic/ethical substitution
HST.linkedContent: simple, homogenous, calculation of cloning—but every unit is irreplaceable in its factual existence (Kant)—so to be ethical, must be conscious, must be auto-affected by this uniqueness? > for Derrida, displaced certainty btwn opposition arithmetic/ethical substitution

PPT.content: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance
PPT.linkedContent: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance

LI.content: repeatability of same ensures that full presence of a singularity, in being repeated, references something else, thus rending the full presence it announces
LI.linkedContent: repeatability of same ensures that full presence of a singularity, in being repeated, references something else, thus rending the full presence it announces

LI.content: this something else is where iteration is different from simple repetition
LI.linkedContent: this something else is where iteration is different from simple repetition

TN.content: idiomatic singularity of a gesture is never pure or purely reappropriable and it can’t be separated from a scene, strategy, discursive tactics [where’s the bridge, the passage?]
TN.linkedContent: idiomatic singularity of a gesture is never pure or purely reappropriable and it can’t be separated from a scene, strategy, discursive tactics [where’s the bridge, the passage?]

TN.content: singularity takes place and takes place of (a lieu et tient lieu), inscribing technical prosthetics onto singularity of event itself, because of this spacing: takes place, l’événement d’une venue
TN.linkedContent: singularity takes place and takes place of (a lieu et tient lieu), inscribing technical prosthetics onto singularity of event itself, because of this spacing: takes place, l’événement d’une venue

TN.content: singularity [never assured] doit être couru comme une chance ou un risque: Nancy’s a bettor, thinker of the bet (pari), a desperate bettor, never stops staking, committing (d’engager), calculating w/ exactitude hyperbolic odds (gages): not counting on gains (bénéfice) of an “argument du pari” [Pascal] or any salut
TN.linkedContent: singularity [never assured] doit être couru comme une chance ou un risque: Nancy’s a bettor, thinker of the bet (pari), a desperate bettor, never stops staking, committing (d’engager), calculating w/ exactitude hyperbolic odds (gages): not counting on gains (bénéfice) of an “argument du pari” [Pascal] or any salut

AD.content: first affection of subject in ipseity: singular as replaceable > substitution announces destiny, subjection (as hôte and hostage), of subjectivity
AD.linkedContent: first affection of subject in ipseity: singular as replaceable > substitution announces destiny, subjection (as hôte and hostage), of subjectivity

BSi.content: know-how of fox, cunning, know-how to trick, perjure, dissimulate, not make known
BSi.linkedContent: know-how of fox, cunning, know-how to trick, perjure, dissimulate, not make known

BSi.content: le savoir-faire sans faire-savoir (know-how w/out making known)
BSi.linkedContent: le savoir-faire sans faire-savoir (know-how w/out making known)

BSi.content: to think the marionette, difference btwn marionettes, not the living of life but a living w/out being—simulacrum of being, prosthesis, substitute for the being of the thing itself—fetish—life death at same time > marionette [Marion’s Dieu sans l’Être]
BSi.linkedContent: to think the marionette, difference btwn marionettes, not the living of life but a living w/out being—simulacrum of being, prosthesis, substitute for the being of the thing itself—fetish—life death at same time > marionette [Marion’s Dieu sans l’Être]
